name: datadog
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Datadog resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`datadog` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-datadog).

apiKey.description: (Required unless validate is false) Datadog API key. This can also be set via the DD_API_KEY environment variable.

apiUrl.description:
The API URL. This can also be set via the DD_HOST environment variable. Note that this URL must not end with the /api/
path. For example, https://api.datadoghq.com/ is a correct value, while https://api.datadoghq.com/api/ is not. And if
you're working with "EU" version of Datadog, use https://api.datadoghq.eu/.

appKey.description: (Required unless validate is false) Datadog APP key. This can also be set via the DD_APP_KEY environment variable.

validate.description:
Enables validation of the provided API and APP keys during provider initialization. Default is true. When false, api_key
and app_key won't be checked.

dashId.description: The ID of the dashboard to add

type.description: The type of this dashboard. Available options are: `custom_timeboard`, `custom_screenboard`, `integration_screenboard`, `integration_timeboard`, and `host_timeboard`

default.description: The default value for the template variable on dashboard load.

prefix.description: The tag prefix associated with the variable. Only tags with this prefix will appear in the variable dropdown.

templateVariables.description: The template variable names and assumed values under the given preset

iframeDefinition.description: The definition for an Iframe widget.

imageDefinition.description: The definition for an Image widget

period.description: How often to repeat as an integer. For example to repeat every 3 days, select a `type` of `days` and a `period` of `3`.

rrule.description: The RRULE standard for defining recurring events. For example, to have a recurring event on the first day of each month, use `FREQ=MONTHLY;INTERVAL=1`. Most common rrule options from the iCalendar Spec are supported. Attributes specifying the duration in RRULE are not supported (for example, `DTSTART`, `DTEND`, `DURATION`).

type.description: One of `days`, `weeks`, `months`, or `years`

untilDate.description: The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestamp. `until_occurrences` and `until_date` are mutually exclusive.

untilOccurrences.description: How many times the downtime will be rescheduled. `until_occurrences` and `until_date` are mutually exclusive.

weekDays.description: A list of week days to repeat on. Choose from: `Mon`, `Tue`, `Wed`, `Thu`, `Fri`, `Sat` or `Sun`. Only applicable when `type` is `weeks`. First letter must be capitalized.

container.description: The container where the archive will be stored.

path.description: The path where the archive will be stored.
Path where the archive will be stored.
Path where the archive will be stored.

isEnabled.description: A boolean stating if the exclusion is active or not.

name.description: The name of the exclusion filter.

query.description: Logs filter criteria. Only logs matching this filter criteria are considered for this index.
Logs filter criteria. Only logs matching this filter criteria are considered for this index.

aggregationType.description: The type of aggregation to use. This field can't be updated after creation.

path.description: The path to the value the log-based metric will aggregate on (only used if the aggregation type is a "distribution"). This field can't be updated after creation.

query.description: The search query - following the log search syntax.

path.description: The path to the value the log-based metric will be aggregated over.

tagName.description: Name of the tag that gets created.

recoveryWindow.description: Describes how long an anomalous metric must be normal before the alert recovers.

triggerWindow.description: Describes how long a metric must be anomalous before an alert triggers.

critical.description: The monitor `CRITICAL` recovery threshold. Must be a number.

criticalRecovery.description: The monitor `CRITICAL` recovery threshold. Must be a number.

ok.description: The monitor `OK` threshold. Must be a number.

unknown.description: The monitor `UNKNOWN` threshold. Must be a number.

warning.description: The monitor `WARNING` threshold. Must be a number.

warningRecovery.description: The monitor `WARNING` recovery threshold. Must be a number.

id.description: ID of the permission to assign.

condition.description: A rule case contains logical operations (`>`,`>=`, `&&`, `||`) to determine if a signal should be generated based on the event counts in the previously defined queries.

notifications.description: Notification targets for each rule case.

evaluationWindow.description: A time window is specified to match when at least one of the cases matches true. This is a sliding window and evaluates in real time.

keepAlive.description: Once a signal is generated, the signal will remain open if a case is matched at least once within this keep alive window.

distinctFields.description: Field for which the cardinality is measured. Sent as an array.

metric.description: The target field to aggregate over when using the sum or max aggregations.

numerator.description: The sum of all the `good` events.

targetDisplay.description: A string representation of the target that indicates its precision. It uses trailing zeros to show significant decimal places (e.g. `98.00`).

timeframe.description: The time frame for the objective. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API documentation page. Available options to choose from are: `7d`, `30d`, `90d`.

warning.description: The objective's warning value in `[0,100]`. This must be greater than the target value.

warningDisplay.description: A string representation of the warning target (see the description of the target_display field for details).

field.description: Required when type = `http_header`. Defines the header to use to extract the value

type.description: Defines the source to use to extract the value. Allowed enum values: `http_body`, `http_header`.

value.description: The value of the global variable.

assertions.description: Assertions used for the test. Multiple `assertion` blocks are allowed with the structure below.

extractedValues.description: Values to parse and save as variables from the response.

requestBasicauth.description: The HTTP basic authentication credentials. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

requestDefinition.description: The request for the api step.

requestQuery.description: Query arguments name and value map.

subtype.description: The subtype of the Synthetic multistep API test step, currently only supporting `http`.

operator.description: Assertion operator. **Note** Only some combinations of `type` and `operator` are valid (please refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test)).

property.description: If assertion type is `header`, this is the header name.

target.description: Expected value. Depends on the assertion type, refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test) for details.

targetjsonpath.description: Expected structure if `operator` is `validatesJSONPath`. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

type.description: Type of assertion. Choose from `body`, `header`, `responseTime`, `statusCode`. **Note** Only some combinations of `type` and `operator` are valid (please refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test)).
Synthetics test type (`api` or `browser`).
Synthetics test type (`api` or `browser`).

dnsServer.description: DNS server to use for DNS tests (`subtype = "dns"`).

host.description: Host name to perform the test with.

port.description: Port to use when performing the test.

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for the test. Defaults to `60`.

url.description: The URL to send the request to.

settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource

path. For example, https://api.datadoghq.com/ is a correct value, while https://api.datadoghq.com/api/ is not. And if
you're working with "EU" version of Datadog, use https://api.datadoghq.eu/.

and app_key won't be checked.

enableLogsSample.description:
A boolean indicating whether or not to include a list of log values which triggered the alert. This is only used by log
monitors. Defaults to `false`.

escalationMessage.description: A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the `@username` notification allowed elsewhere.

evaluationDelay.description:
(Only applies to metric alert) Time (in seconds) to delay evaluation, as a non-negative integer. For example, if the
value is set to `300` (5min), the `timeframe` is set to `last_5m` and the time is 7:00, the monitor will evaluate data
from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled metrics to ensure the monitor will always have
data during evaluation.

forceDelete.description:
A boolean indicating whether this monitor can be deleted even if its referenced by other resources (e.g. SLO,
composite monitor).

groupbySimpleMonitor.description:
Whether or not to trigger one alert if any source breaches a threshold. This is only used by log monitors. Defaults to
`false`.

includeTags.description:
A boolean indicating whether notifications from this monitor automatically insert its triggering tags into the title.
Defaults to `true`.

locked.description:
A boolean indicating whether changes to to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins. Defaults to
`false`.

message.description: A message to include with notifications for this monitor.

monitorThresholdWindows.description:
A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m` . Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.

newHostDelay.description:
Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor
results. Should be a non negative integer. Defaults to `300`.

noDataTimeframe.description:
The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Provider defaults to 10 minutes. We
recommend at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.

notifyAudit.description: A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor. Defaults to `false`.

notifyNoData.description: A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults to `false`.

priority.description: Integer from 1 (high) to 5 (low) indicating alert severity.

query.description:
The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and the syntax is different depending
on the monitor type, please see the [API Reference](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor) for
details. `terraform plan` will validate query contents unless `validate` is set to `false`. **Note:** APM latency data
is now available as Distribution Metrics. Existing monitors have been migrated automatically but all terraformed
monitors can still use the existing metrics. We strongly recommend updating monitor definitions to query the new
metrics. To learn more, or to see examples of how to update your terraform definitions to utilize the new distribution
metrics, see the [detailed doc](https://docs.datadoghq.com/tracing/guide/ddsketch_trace_metrics/).

renotifyInterval.description:
The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only
re-notify if it's not resolved.

requireFullWindow.description:
A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set
this to `false` for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped. Default: `true` for `on average`, `at
all times` and `in total` aggregation. `false` otherwise.

silenced.description:
Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is `0`. Use `-1` if you want to unmute
the scope. Deprecated: the silenced parameter is being deprecated in favor of the downtime resource. This will be
removed in the next major version of the Terraform Provider.

tags.description:
A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors
page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

thresholdWindows.description:
A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m`. Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.
thresholdWindows.deprecationMessage: Define `monitor_threshold_windows` list with one element instead.

thresholds.deprecationMessage: Define `monitor_thresholds` list with one element instead.

timeoutH.description: The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.

type.description:
The type of the monitor. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the
Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor). Note: The monitor type
cannot be changed after a monitor is created.

validate.description: If set to `false`, skip the validation call done during plan.

enableLogsSample.description:
A boolean indicating whether or not to include a list of log values which triggered the alert. This is only used by log
monitors. Defaults to `false`.

escalationMessage.description: A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the `@username` notification allowed elsewhere.

evaluationDelay.description:
(Only applies to metric alert) Time (in seconds) to delay evaluation, as a non-negative integer. For example, if the
value is set to `300` (5min), the `timeframe` is set to `last_5m` and the time is 7:00, the monitor will evaluate data
from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled metrics to ensure the monitor will always have
data during evaluation.

forceDelete.description:
A boolean indicating whether this monitor can be deleted even if its referenced by other resources (e.g. SLO,
composite monitor).

groupbySimpleMonitor.description:
Whether or not to trigger one alert if any source breaches a threshold. This is only used by log monitors. Defaults to
`false`.

includeTags.description:
A boolean indicating whether notifications from this monitor automatically insert its triggering tags into the title.
Defaults to `true`.

locked.description:
A boolean indicating whether changes to to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins. Defaults to
`false`.

message.description: A message to include with notifications for this monitor.

monitorThresholdWindows.description:
A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m` . Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.

newHostDelay.description:
Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor
results. Should be a non negative integer. Defaults to `300`.

noDataTimeframe.description:
The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Provider defaults to 10 minutes. We
recommend at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.

notifyAudit.description: A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor. Defaults to `false`.

notifyNoData.description: A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults to `false`.

priority.description: Integer from 1 (high) to 5 (low) indicating alert severity.

query.description:
The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and the syntax is different depending
on the monitor type, please see the [API Reference](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor) for
details. `terraform plan` will validate query contents unless `validate` is set to `false`. **Note:** APM latency data
is now available as Distribution Metrics. Existing monitors have been migrated automatically but all terraformed
monitors can still use the existing metrics. We strongly recommend updating monitor definitions to query the new
metrics. To learn more, or to see examples of how to update your terraform definitions to utilize the new distribution
metrics, see the [detailed doc](https://docs.datadoghq.com/tracing/guide/ddsketch_trace_metrics/).

renotifyInterval.description:
The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only
re-notify if it's not resolved.

requireFullWindow.description:
A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set
this to `false` for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped. Default: `true` for `on average`, `at
all times` and `in total` aggregation. `false` otherwise.

silenced.description:
Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is `0`. Use `-1` if you want to unmute
the scope. Deprecated: the silenced parameter is being deprecated in favor of the downtime resource. This will be
removed in the next major version of the Terraform Provider.

tags.description:
A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors
page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

thresholdWindows.description:
A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m`. Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.
thresholdWindows.deprecationMessage: Define `monitor_threshold_windows` list with one element instead.

thresholds.deprecationMessage: Define `monitor_thresholds` list with one element instead.

timeoutH.description: The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.

datadog:index/timeBoard:TimeBoard.description:
## Import

Timeboards can be imported using their numeric ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import datadog:index/timeBoard:TimeBoard my_service_timeboard 2081
```

resource are to be used. Mutually exclusive with `services` key.

services.description: A list of service names and service keys. **Deprecated.** set "individual*services" to true and use datadog*pagerduty*integration*service_object

subdomain.description: Your PagerDuty accounts personalized subdomain name.

serviceKey.description:
Your Service name associated service key in PagerDuty. Note: Since the Datadog API never returns service keys, it is
impossible to detect [drifts](https://www.hashicorp.com/blog/detecting-and-managing-drift-with-terraform). The best way
to solve a drift is to manually mark the Service Object resource with [terraform
taint](https://www.terraform.io/docs/commands/taint.html) to have it destroyed and recreated.
